intro: Salmea pubescens, commonly known as the hairy salmea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Salmea pubescens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
